meanings.definition: A person who writes about the lives of saints.
meanings.sent1: The hagiographers carefully recorded the miracles performed by the saints.
meanings.sent2: Many hagiographers study ancient texts to learn about the lives of saints.
meanings.sent3: The hagiographers joked that they had to be saintly themselves to write about saints.
meanings.sent4: In the world of hagiographers, the pen is mightier than the sword.
meanings.sent5: The hagiographers' writings brought the stories of saints to life for generations to come.

meanings.sent1: We discussed the impact of hagiographers on religious literature in class.
meanings.sent2: The hagiographers' works are often filled with tales of miracles and faith.
meanings.sent3: The hagiographers were so dedicated to their craft that they often dreamt of saints.
meanings.sent4: The hagiographers' pens danced across the pages, creating vivid portraits of saints.
meanings.sent5: The hagiographers' stories painted a colorful picture of the lives of holy figures.

meanings.definition: Those who document the lives of holy people.
meanings.sent1: The hagiographers traveled far and wide to gather stories of the holy.
meanings.sent2: Many hagiographers spend years researching before writing about holy individuals.
meanings.sent3: The hagiographers' dedication to their work was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent4: In the eyes of the hagiographers, every saint had a unique and fascinating story.
meanings.sent5: The hagiographers' writings preserved the legacies of the holy for future generations.
